body_html:
boringssl is building for me on Ubuntu 16.04 with gcc 5.4.0.

On RHEL with gcc 4.8.5 I recreated the problem. I'm going to be doing more investigation on it.

boringssl is only needed for google cloud platform, if you don't need tensorflow built with support for that function you can modify .tf_configure.bazelrc and find the line for gcp_support and modify the value to false:

build --define with_gcp_support=false

[ I have been deleting $HOME/.cache after changing .tf_configure.bazelrc to force everything to be re-built ]

body:
boringssl is building for me on Ubuntu 16.04 with gcc 5.4.0.

On RHEL with gcc 4.8.5 I recreated the problem. I'm going to be doing more investigation on it.

boringssl is only needed for google cloud platform, if you don't need tensorflow built with support for that function you can modify .tf_configure.bazelrc  and find the line for gcp_support and modify the value to false:

build --define with_gcp_support=false

[ I have been deleting $HOME/.cache after changing .tf_configure.bazelrc to force everything to be re-built ]
